files.text:
2/6/26, 4:42 PM

Ways to Describe Energy in Icaros – Koshinete

Ways to Describe Energy in Icaros

In the Shipibo medical system, doctors will study all dimensions of the body, from material, to
energetic, to divine. Because so much of this work is looking at the energetic causes of
phenomena, they have developed an extensive vocabulary to describe all kinds of energies.
Here are 3 main ways to describe energy:
Niwe – wind-like energy, seen as more mobile and can easily move in and out of a body. It
can come from energies associated with animals, places, dead people, other healers, and
can be either positive or negative.
Nete – Universe. Like a day to day painting of our being. It is subject to change, just like our
mood. It represents the state of our body, mind, and soul in a given moment. Our nete, just like
our body, is our energetic home.
Kano – A connection structure, a channel. The kano represents all the connections with
energies or spirits that you have built along your life-path, including your connection to the
Divine. It can be seen in ceremonies as a visual representation, a stamp that illustrates your
medicinal essence. For example, you can see it as images of doctors, bright lights, jaguars, or
towers of light around the person.
It illustrates their spiritual force to varying degrees, similar to having different levels of
academic study. You can distinguish the image of a beginner versus the image of an
experienced healer. From these connections stem the icaros, healing power, and more.
https://koshinete.com/lesson/ways-to-describe-energy-in-icaros/

1/5

 2/6/26, 4:42 PM

Ways to Describe Energy in Icaros – Koshinete

You can build this kano through diets. When this channel is clear and bright, it is healthy and
connection to God or medicine is good. When the channel is not in good condition, their
connection to God and medicinal energy gets blocked and the healer can get sick.
There is also a negative kano, a channel that connects you to dark energy. This is the kano of
dark magic.
You will see these words used very often in icaros, and you can begin to familiarize yourself
with this way of feeling and seeing the world. Full of various energy forms!

https://koshinete.com/lesson/ways-to-describe-energy-in-icaros/

2/5

 2/6/26, 4:42 PM

Ways to Describe Energy in Icaros – Koshinete

“Guardianes” by Luis Tamani, is a great example of an illustration of a
kano. In this case, Maestra Olivia Arevalo’s kano is represented by various
jaguars, anacondas, and kene designs. This kano represents her connection
to the plant realms and has a life of its own.
https://koshinete.com/lesson/ways-to-describe-energy-in-icaros/

3/5

Sadness/exhaustion

 Step 2: Describe where you are sad

-meran (suffix) → inside

 Example:

 Step 3: Begin to straighten
